1.text: Paul, sent of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the holy ones being in Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:

2.text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ,

3.text: Praised be God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, he having praised us in every spiritual praise in heavenly things in Christ:

4.text: As he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, for us to be holy and blameless before him in love:

5.text: Having determined us beforehand for adoption as a son by Jesus Christ to him, according to benevolence of his will,

6.text: To the praise of the glory of his grace, in which he rendered us acceptable in the beloved.

7.text: In whom we have redemption by his blood, the letting go of faults, according to the riches of his grace;

8.text: In which he abounded to us in all wisdom and intelligence;

9.text: Having made known to us the mystery of his will, according to his benevolence which he purposed in himself:

10.text: For the arrangement of the completion of the times, to unite in a whole all things in Christ, both the things in the heavens, and the things upon earth; in him:

11.text: In whom also we were cast by lot, determined beforehand according to the purpose of him performing all things according to the counsel of his will:

12.text: For us to be to the praise of his glory, who before hoped in Christ.

13.text: In whom ye also, having heard the word of truth, the good news of your salvation: in whom also having believed, ye were sealed by the holy Spirit of solemn promise,

14.text: Which is the pledge of our inheritance for the redemption of the acquisition, to the praise of his glory.

15.text: For this, I also, having heard the faith among you in the Lord Jesus, and love to all the holy,

16.text: Cease not returning thanks for you, making remembrance of you in my prayers;

17.text: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, might give you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in his knowledge:

18.text: The eyes of your understanding enlightened; for you to know what is the hope of his calling, and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the holy ones,

19.text: And what the surpassing greatness of his power to us believing, according to the action of the might of his strength,

20.text: Which he performed in Christ, having raised him from the dead, and he sat on his right hand in the heavenlies,

21.text: Above every beginning, and authority, and power, and property, and every name named, not only in this life, but in that about to be:

22.text: And placed all things under his, feet, and gave him head over all things to the church,

23.text: Which is his body, the completion of him completing all things in all.
